attributes.action: Call upon the Welsh Assembly (with the support of the Welsh Secretary) to take over control of the Cleddau Bridge from Pembrokeshire County Council and to remove the tolls.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Pembrokeshire County Council makes almost £3m a year from the tolls over the Cleddau Bridge in Pembrokeshire.  75p each way for car drivers.
The Scottish Parliament was persuaded to take control of the bridge to the Isle of Skye and remove the tolls.
Tolls are a stealth tax on locals who regularly use it for work (as well as fleecing tourists) and could be seen as hampering economic development in the County, as well as providing £3m to the Council! 
Removing the tolls could also reduce traffic problems on the Merlins Bridge roundabout, at peak times!

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Call upon the Welsh Assembly (with the support of the Welsh Secretary) to take over control of the Cleddau Bridge from Pembrokeshire County Council and to remove the tolls."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.pm.gov.uk/output/Page13420.asp

Prime Minister's Office
